description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 INTRODUCTION TO THE AGIR-PROGRAMME:
The AGIR programme (Programa de Acções para uma Governação Inclusiva e Responsável) constitutes the support mechanism that the Embassy of Sweden (EoS) has chosen for its civil society support and represents a very large part of the EoS’ total support to civil society in Mozambique. The support mechanism is an indirect support i.e. the EoS has agreements and provides direct financial support to four intermediary partner organisations (IPOs) where each IPO, in turn, enters into agreements and provides financial support to Mozambican civil society organisations (CSOs) their so-called partner organisations (POs). There are, in total, approximately 70 POs within the AGIR-programme. The financial support from IPOs to POs is, mainly, core support. The AGIR-programme is, therefore, made up of one overarching programme (“the overarching programme”) for which all four IPOs are responsible, and four sub-programmes (“the sub-programmes”) where each IPO is responsible for one. Each sub-programme constitutes a contribution in Trac. The four IPOs are Diakonia, Oxfam Ibis, Oxfam Novib and We Effect. The AGIR-programme started in 2010. The current ongoing second phase covers six years (2015-2020). When the second phase of the AGIR-programme was appraised, at the end of 2014, for a total period of six years (2015-2020), a six-year programme proposal was submitted for the overarching programme as well as one for each of the sub-programmes. The overarching programme was appraised in a Word document “external” to the Trac-system ("Annex A to Appraisal of Intervention Second Phase of AGIR – Description and Assessment of the Overarching Programme” - “Annex A") since the overarching programme is not connected to one specific agreement and one specific budget (which is a requirement for contributions within Trac). The follow-up of, and the work with, the overarching programme is done within each of the sub-programme contributions, for example, within the risk- and results registers found there within. The four sub-programmes were appraised in a separate Trac contribution (51140067; 51140085; 51140086; & 51140087).
All the four sub-programmes work towards a common results framework where each IPO’s operations contribute to the overarching goal for the AGIR-programme. In addition, there is a results framework per sub-programme. The four IPO report commonly to the AGIR donors on their common results framework and carry out common activities to attain the programme’s goal. The overall responsibility for common reporting and for organizing common activities rotates among the IPOs. There is a MOU between the IPOs that regulates this. There is also a MOU between the donors to the AGIR programme, which regulates the donors’ collaboration and responsibilities vis-à-vis the AGIR-programme. When the second phase of the AGIR programme commenced (in 2015) the Embassies of Netherlands and Denmark were funding some of the sub-programmes. Sweden is, however, the main donor and also the lead donor. Sweden is sole donor to the Oxfam Ibis sub-programme. Currently, there is an ongoing dialogue – primarily with the Netherlands – on continued support for the last three years of the second phase of AGIR for the two sub-programmes they are currently supporting.
The overarching goal for the AGIR programme is: A Mozambican society where its citizens, particularly the most marginalized groups, fully enjoy their rights to inclusion and equity, to redistribution of wealth created from the country’s patrimony, to accessible and affordable public services of good quality, to basic civil freedoms and to political representation and participation; in a peaceful and ecologically sustainable environment. The sub-programmes have different thematic focus:
Diakonia: focuses on the right to free and fair elections and to a multi-party democracy, on marginalized and vulnerable groups’ human rights (women, children & persons living with disabilities), on access to justice, on sexual and reproductive health and rights, as well as on gender based violence.
Oxfam Ibis: focuses on the right to information generally, but also specifically in relation to the extractive industries, on free media (including investigative journalism), on strengthening of parliaments at all levels, as well as on actors of change whose goal is improved access to and quality of fundamental services (particularly health and education).
Oxfam Novib: focuses on oversight of public budgets and expenditures, on public resources allocation and social audits, on fair tax collection, as well as on marginalised and vulnerable groups’ human rights (women, LGBT, de elderly and people living with HIV/AIDS), as well as on sexual and reproductive health and rights, and on gender based violence.
We Effect: focuses on land rights, on the effects of the extraction of natural resources, on rural development, food security, climate change and environment.
DIAKONIA SUBPROGRAMME:
Diakonia’s Subprogramme will help to achieve the AGIR II results, change the prevailing situation in the country, by supporting national and local CSOs so they can work towards a more democratic society where a just peace prevails, the government is accountable, and citizens, government and the private sector respect human and socio-economic rights, in particular those of women, youth and people unable to resolve their current vulnerability. Diakonia’s role is to help CSOs to become more legitimate, pro-active and competent agencies as citizens’ voices and organizers that in key debates and decision-making processes that affect Mozambique’s development.
In particular, Diakonia will support CSO work that promotes: => Improved democratic governance, in particular in the electoral processes, encouraging political dialogue to maintain peace as a pre-requisite for the advancement of and respect for the human rights of all citizens, women and men, youth and children; to guarantee the access to basic services; to be engaged in advocacy and participation in decision-making on legal and policy frameworks, and monitoring the budget, policies and services. => Increased democracy and accountability (legal, political, social and financial) by duty bearers, improving citizen-government dialogue and acting as a “watch dog” of the work done by elected bodies. => Respect for human rights, through interventions that improve policy and legal frameworks, respect for the human and socio-economic rights of women, youth, children and social groups enabling them to escape their vulnerability, and reducing gender based violence and its root causes. => Gender equality, through mainstreaming in programme interventions and through specific interventions that address violations of a woman’s right to equality. More specifically, Diakonia will support interventions that improve access of young women and men to quality sexual and reproductive rights. => Stronger engagement with government to advocate for and defend citizens’ right to the benefits from extractive industries, especially pointed to those citizens (women and men) directly affected by these industries.
The expected results will be achieved through close engagement with partners, including capacity building, and harmonisation with the three other IPOs in accordance with the Busan principles, as presented in the overarching proposal.
The thematic areas chose by Diakonia for its Subprogramme, within each accountability area, aims at producing results to validate the ToC. In fact, - In the area of Participation and social accountability - The thematic area of Diakonia Subprogramme will be focusing at right to inclusion and equality, looking at the Legitimacy of Governance Processes considering the context of a poor state, still weak in terms of service delivery and of the low level of responsiveness of the duty bearers before the right holders. The main focus here is on empowerment of the right holders. - Political accountability and multiparty democracy system – The thematic area of Diakonia’s Subprogramme will focusing on right to accessible and affordable services of good quality, looking at the rights holders’ empowerment and policy dialogue considering the context of a democracy still incipient, and the rule of law yet to be consolidated. The main focus here is on governance. - Legal accountability, the rule of law and respect for human rights – The thematic area of Diakonia’s Subprogramme will be focusing on right to political representation and participation, looking at the Human rights advancement, protection, respect and fulfilment, considering that the human rights is a Constitutional right but it is not yet sufficiently advanced in the legal framework, and not even applied by the duty bearers as a legal practice in the legal system. The main focus here is on human rights.
Diakonia’s revised ToC has two components - CSOs receiving institutional capacity for internal reinforcement to be able to act firstly on the rights holders, and, then, together with the rights holders and other actors, receiving support to act on the duty bearers.
The two components of Diakonia´s ToC are: 1) Organisational and institutional development - Partner organisations’ capacity to be enhanced to increase their effectiveness and relevance to work for change, impacting on the various rights holders in the programme’s thematic fields; 2) Social change dynamics – Indicating how partner organisations can work together with the rights holders and other stakeholders to bring about structural and sustainable change in the human rights situation at policy and governance practices level.
The ToC is thus, about changing (i) the way the right holders see themselves before the duty bearers, be them the State institutions or non-state actors, empowerment leading to behaviour change; and (ii) the duty bearers becoming aware of their role as civil servants before the right holders, as well as the politicians, to serve better the right holders in order to consolidate the democratic state, by using practices in conformity to the principles of good governance.
Diakonia will work with two levels of target groups: (i) Primary target groups: CSOs, networks and forums, that receive resources and capacity from the Subprogramme aiming at changing behaviour at the level of the right holders and at change attitudes when serving, at the level of the duty bearers according to the ToC.;
(ii) Secondary target groups: government institutions, the elected, public servants, political parties, the private sector, communities, families and citizens that are targeted by partners’ interventions. Representing, mainly the duty bearers, a target of the primary group together working the right holders, to change policy practices and policies, are aiming at a new normative setting in society and State affairs, according to the ToC.
Diakonia partner’s portfolio is constituted by 14 partners receiving core-funding and 07 receiving agile, innovative or small funds. Since the start of the AGIR II, 03 organizations have been phased out.
Diakonia focus on organisations at the national level and in two provinces: Zambézia and Niassa. Also focus on strengthening existing formal and informal networks. As already stated, the selection of local partners reflects the strategic objectives of Diakonia’s AGIR Subprogramme. Decentralised support is a new Diakonia strategy for AGIR II, in an effort to encourage networks to work more with their members, (not just focusing on planning specific activities connected to commemorative dates and events such as women’s month, the child’s fortnight, HIV/AIDs day, human rights day) and to be more strategic and plan for changes at different levels of governance (central, provincial and local).

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Detta kompletterande insatsbeslut avser en föreslagen förlängning av Diakonias subprogram inom AGIR II, för året 2018 med tilläggsbelopp 39 207 000 SEK.
Sverige är med detta beslut enda finansiär till insatsen, men Nederländerna som idag samfinansierar programmet förbereder beslut om att bidra till samma insats även under 2018. Även om Nederländerna fattar ett sådant beslut så förutses aktivitetsplan och budget bli oförändrad.
Den ettåriga förlängningen (jfr övriga AGIR-program som förlängs med tre år) bygger framför allt på ambassadens bedömning av Diakonias kapacitet vad gäller styrning av programmet. Ambassaden och Diakonia har enats om en handlingsplan (juni 2017-juni 2018) för att hantera dessa svagheter. Handlingsplanen följs upp av både Diakonia och ambassaden och dess resultat kommer att ligga till grund för bedömning av fortsatt stöd 2019-2020.
INTRODUKTION TILL AGIR-.PROGRAMMET AGIR-programmet (Programa de Acções para uma Governação Inclusiva e Responsável) är en gemensam stödmekanism till ett sjuttiontal civilsamhällesorganisationer i Mocambique. Stödet är ett indirekt stöd där svenska ambassaden i Maputo har ett direkt finansiellt stöd och avtal med fyra intermediära partnerorganisationer (IPO) som i sin tur stödjer och har avtal med ett större antal (totalt ca 70) moçambikiska civilsamhällesorganisationer – deras s.k. partnerorganisationer (PO).stödet från IPO till PO utgörs av kärnstöd.
AGIR-programmet består av ett övergripande program där alla fyra IPOs - Diakonia, Oxfam Ibis, Oxfam Novib och We Effect - har gemensamt ansvar, samt fyra underliggande subprogram där varje IPO ansvarar för varsitt program. AGIR startade 2010 och den pågående andra fasen täcker sex år (2015-2020). AGIR-programmets övergripande mål är ett moçambikiska samhälle där medborgare, särskilt de mest utsatta, åtnjuter sin rättighet till integration och rättvisa, till omfördelning av välstånd som skapas av landets resurser, till lättillgängliga och prisvärda offentliga tjänster av god kvalitet, och till grundläggande medborgerliga friheter och politisk representation, samt deltagande, i en fredlig och ekologiskt hållbar miljö.
- Diakonia fokuserar på rätten till fria & rättvisa val och till flerpartidemokrati, på marginaliserade och utsatta gruppers mänskliga rättigheter (kvinnor, barn & personer med funktionsnedsättning), rättshjälp, sexuell/reproduktiv hälsa & rättigheter, samt könsrelaterat våld. - Oxfam Ibis arbetar med på rätten till information, särskilt i förhållande till naturresursutvinning, mediefrihet, stärkandet av parlament på alla nivåer, förbättrad tillgång och kvalitet av grundläggande hälso- och utbildningstjänster. - Oxfam Novib fokuserar på översyn av statens budget och resursallokering, rättvis skatteuppbörd, på utsatta gruppers mänskliga rättigheter, sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och rättigheter, samt könsbaserat våld. - We Effect fokuserar på markrättigheter, på effekterna av naturresursutvinning, landsbygdsutveckling, matsäkerhet, klimatförändringar och miljö.
FÖRSLAG UTFORMNING AV STÖD Erfarenheten visar att Diakonia har haft svårigheter att presentera programdokument, resultatramverk och riskregister i genomförandet av AGIR-programmet, som uppfyller Sidas krav. Finansiell rapportering och revision har varit av otillräcklig kvalitet, och tecknade avtal med PO:s har saknat obligatoriska delar. Därför föreslås ett tillägg av pågående programperiod med ett år (2018). Under detta år ska en åtgärdsplan genomföras, inför en eventuell bedömning av fortsatt stöd.
PROGRAMMETS INNEHÅLL Diakonias subprogram förväntas bidra till att uppnå de övergripande resultaten för AGIR genom att de stöder organisationer i arbetet för ett demokratiskt samhälle med större ansvarsutkrävande och stärkta mänskliga rättigheter och ökad jämställdhet. Detta gör man genom att arbeta med tre tematiska områden: 1) Medborgardeltagande och jämställdhet; 2) Ansvarsutkrävande och demokratiskt flerpartissystem, tillgång till sociala tjänster; och 3) Rättssäkerhet och respekt för de mänskliga rättigheterna.
Diakonia vidarebefordrar medel via kärnstöd till 14 organisationer samt via tilläggsmedel ("small grants") till sju organisationer. Två av dessa organisationer arbetar på provinsnivå i Zambézia och Niassa.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
